intro: Urostachys javanicus, commonly known as the Java spurge, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its succulent, often hairy stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and rocky areas. Its leaves are alternate and may have a waxy coating, while its flowers are usually greenish or yellowish. Urostachys javanicus is sometimes cultivated for its ornamental value due to its unique appearance and resilience.
